title: Pepper Sticks
description: Take a flavorful journey with these sizzling skewers, where the heat of peppers meets tender bites of goodness.
steps: Thread chicken, bell pepper, and onion onto skewers.
Mix garlic, soy sauce, black pepper, and oil for marinade.
Coat skewers with marinade, then grill until cooked.

title: Tandoori Chicken
description: Immerse your taste buds in the smoky charm of the tandoor, where spices and chicken unite in fiery harmony.
ingredients: 1 cup buttermilk (or 1 cup milk with 1 tbsp white vinegar or lemon juice)
Cooking oil or butter for greasing the pan
steps: Preheat griddle or pan.
Prepare dry ingredients.
Prepare wet ingredients.
Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Grease griddle or pan.
Cook the pancakes and flip.

title: Grilled Chicken
description: Fire-kissed and full of flavor, these grilled delights are your passport to BBQ bliss.
ingredients: Cooking spray for greasing the grill
steps: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and lemon juice to create a marinade.
Coat the chicken with the marinade and let it sit for 30 minutes.
Grease the grill with cooking spray.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
Garnish with fresh herbs and serve.

title: Paneer Tikka
description: Vegetarian bliss on a skewer, where marinated paneer takes on a spicy twist.
ingredients: Chopped coriander leaves and lemon wedges for garnish
steps: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, tikka masala, lemon juice, oil, and salt to create a marinade.
Add the paneer cubes to the marinade and coat them well. Let it marinate for 30 minutes.
Thread the marinated paneer onto wooden skewers.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat and grease the grates.
Grill the paneer skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally until they are charred and cooked through.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and lemon wedges before serving.

title: Honey Chicken
description: A tantalizing dance of sweet and savory, where honey-infused chicken makes every bite a delight.
ingredients: Sesame seeds and chopped green onions for garnish
steps: In a bowl, mix honey, soy sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, minced ginger, salt, and pepper to create a marinade.
Add the diced chicken to the marinade and let it marinate for 20-30 minutes.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add the marinated chicken. Cook until browned and cooked through.
Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

title: Vadai
description: Crispy, savory South Indian fritters that are golden, delicious, and impossible to resist.
ingredients: 1 cup urad dal (black gram dal), soaked for 3-4 hours
A handful of curry leaves, chopped
steps: Drain and grind the soaked urad dal into a smooth batter. Add a little water if needed.
In a bowl, mix the ground urad dal batter, chopped green chilies, chopped onion, chopped curry leaves, cumin seeds, and salt.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Take a small portion of the batter and flatten it to form a vada shape.
Fry the vadas in hot oil until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot.

title: Bonda
description: Pillowy and perfect, these South Indian wonders are a bite-sized delight.
ingredients: A handful of curry leaves, chopped
steps: In a bowl, mix gram flour, rice flour, chopped green chilies, chopped onion, chopped curry leaves, cumin seeds, baking soda, and salt.
Add water gradually to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Take small portions of the batter and drop them into the hot oil.
Fry the bondas until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot.

title: Chicken Kebab
description: Skewers of succulence, where marination magic transforms chicken into savory bites of heaven.
ingredients: 500 grams chicken breast, cut into cubes
Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Marinate the Chicken
Thread onto Skewers
Grill the Kebabs
Serve Hot
